prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Detective Arme and I rushed towards the boarding lounge together.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 1
Testimony: We went via the Control Room and peeked in from there to see what was going on inside.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 2
Testimony: We saw a figure standing in the middle of the lounge, and Terran lying on the floor.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 3
Testimony: I hate to say it, but I can only imagine the standing figure mast have been Starbuck.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 4
Testimony: Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure.
Person: Cosmos

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through the testimonies and the evidence provided.

Looking at the testimonies first. Testimony 3 is by Cosmos saying that the standing figure must have been Starbuck. Then, Testimony 4 says Detective Arme fired two warning shots. 

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 15 is a bullet from Arme's gun, which is a .38 caliber. Evidence 10 mentions a bullet hole in the boarding lounge made by a .38-caliber gun. But wait, Evidence 12 is a bullet found in the gutter, which is .10 caliber. Hmm. 

Wait, Cosmos said Arme fired two shots. If Arme's bullets are .38 caliber, then the bullet hole (Evidence 10) matches her gun. But then there's Evidence 12, a .10 caliber bullet found elsewhere. But how does this relate to the testimony?

Wait, Testimony 4 says Arme fired two warning shots. If she fired two shots, then there should be two bullet holes from her gun. However, Evidence 10 says there's only one bullet hole from a .38. That's a contradiction. Because if she fired two shots, there should be two holes, but the evidence shows only one. So maybe Testimony 4 and Evidence 10?

Wait, but Evidence 10 states a single bullet hole from a .38, but Arme's bullets are .38 (Evidence 15). So if she fired two shots, but only one hole is found, that's a contradiction. But then Testimony 4 says she fired two warning shots, which would leave two bullets, but Evidence 10 mentions only one bullet hole. But the actual bullet from Arme's gun (Evidence 15) is found near the victim's oxygen tank. So maybe one of her shots hit the oxygen tank (as per Evidence 8), which had 0% oxygen and was struck by a bullet. So perhaps the two shots: one hit the oxygen tank, and the other... but Evidence 10 says only one bullet hole in the lounge. Wait, the bullet hole in the lounge (Evidence 10) is .38, and the bullet from Arme's gun (Evidence 15) is found near the oxygen tank. So maybe two shots: one hit the tank (bullet found there, Evidence 15) and another hit the wall (bullet hole in lounge, Evidence 10). Then there are two bullets, but the testimony says two shots, which would match two bullets. Wait, but Evidence 10 mentions only one bullet hole. Wait, Evidence 10 says "The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun." So if Arme fired two shots, but there's only one bullet hole, that's a contradiction. Because two shots would leave two holes. But if one of the bullets didn't leave a hole? Like maybe the other hit the oxygen tank, which isn't a wall. The oxygen tank is part of the victim's gear. So the bullet that hit the tank wouldn't leave a hole in the lounge's structure. So the two shots would be: one into the tank (no hole in the wall) and one into the wall (the one hole in Evidence 10). But then, there's another bullet (Evidence 12) which is .10 caliber. But that's a different gun. So maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3 where Cosmos says the figure must have been Starbuck. The evidence that contradicts this could be the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7), which shows the defendant and victim escaping to the boarding lounge. But if the video shows them escaping together, then later the victim is dead and the defendant is there, maybe the figure is Starbuck. But maybe another evidence contradicts that.

Wait, Evidence 16 is a lighter with Athena's prints in the victim's blood. But Aura's Statement (Evidence 14) says the perp held a lighter in left hand and a knife in right. If the lighter has Athena's prints, that would suggest she was the perp, contradicting Cosmos's claim that it was Starbuck. But Cosmos's Testimony 3 says he thinks the figure was Starbuck, but the lighter with Athena's prints would suggest otherwise. So maybe Testimony 3 (Cosmos) is contradicted by Evidence 16 (lighter with Athena's prints). But wait, the testimony is Cosmos saying that the standing figure must have been Starbuck, but if the lighter with Athena's prints was found, that suggests Athena was present. So that's a contradiction. Alternatively, the video (Evidence 7) shows the defendant and victim escaping. If the video ends immediately after, but then the defendant is seen in the lounge, perhaps. But I need to check.

Alternatively, the bullet hole (Evidence 10) is .38, but the bullet found (Evidence 12) is .10. So if Arme fired two .38 shots, where are the bullets? One is near the tank (Evidence 15), and another should be somewhere else, but Evidence 12 is a different caliber. So maybe that's a contradiction. But how does that relate to the testimonies?

Wait, Testimony 4 says Arme fired two warning shots. If those were from her .38, then there should be two .38 bullets. But Evidence 15 is a .38 bullet found near the tank, and Evidence 10 is a bullet hole from a .38. But the other bullet would be missing. Also, Evidence 12 is a .10 bullet found in the gutter. So that's a different gun. So maybe the two shots from Arme's .38 would account for the bullet hole (Evidence 10) and the bullet found near the tank (Evidence 15). But then why is there a .10 bullet (Evidence 12) unrelated? Not sure.

Alternatively, the Lighter (Evidence 16) with Athena's prints contradicts the testimony that the figure was Starbuck. So Testimony 3 (Cosmos says figure was Starbuck) vs Evidence 16 (Athena's prints on lighter). But then the problem is that Aura's Statement (Evidence 14) says the perp held a lighter in left hand and knife in right. If the lighter has Athena's prints, then she was the perp, not Starbuck. Therefore, Testimony 3 is contradicted by Evidence 16.

So the contradiction would be between Testimony 3 (Cosmos says it was Starbuck) and Evidence 16 (lighter with Athena's prints). Alternatively, maybe the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows the defendant (Starbuck) and victim escaping to the corridor, but the video ends. So if the video ends, then maybe Starbuck was there, but the testimony says they saw him in the lounge. But the video might not show the actual murder.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 6: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock has Starbuck's prints. If the defendant was supposed to be in the lounge, but his prints are on the door lock, maybe there's a timing issue. But that's not directly conflicting with the testimonies.

Wait, let's go back. Testimony 3: Cosmos says the standing figure must have been Starbuck. But Evidence 14 (Aura's Statement) says the perp had a lighter in left hand and a knife in right. Evidence 16 is the lighter with Athena's prints. So if the perp had a lighter, and the lighter has Athena's prints, then the perp is Athena, not Starbuck. Therefore, Testimony 3 (Cosmos's claim that it was Starbuck) is contradicted by Evidence 16 (lighter with Athena's prints). That seems like a solid contradiction.

So the answer should be {"evidence": 16, "testimony": 3}

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. So, we need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's go through each testimony and cross-reference with the evidence provided.

First, looking at the testimonies given by Cosmos. There are three of them:

Testimony 0: Detective Arme and I rushed to the Control Room together.
Testimony 1: In the lounge, we saw a figure standing in the middle of the room, and Terran on the floor.
Testimony 2: We were still in the Control Room to the east when the figure fired at us!

Now, let's check the evidence. The key here is to find inconsistencies between what's stated in the testimony and the evidence.

Starting with Testimony 2. Cosmos says they were in the Control Room to the east when the figure fired at them. Let's look at the Control Room door lock details. Evidence 11 is the Control Room Door Lock, which says the door lock to the east can only be operated by the director (which is Cosmos himself) and that it functions with backup power even during outages. So, if the Control Room door was locked and only Cosmos could open it, but according to Testimony 0, both Cosmos and Arme rushed there together. Wait, but maybe that's okay because Arme could have entered if Cosmos let her in. Not sure yet.

But more importantly, Testimony 2 says they were in the Control Room when the figure fired at them. However, looking at Evidence 10: Bullet Hole is a .38-caliber, and Evidence 15: Bullet from Arme's Gun is a .38 caliber. Since Detective Arme uses a .38, maybe she was the one who fired. But Testimony 2 says the figure fired at them. Wait, but in Evidence 14, Aura's Statement mentions the perp had a knife in the right hand and a lighter in the left. If the figure fired, but the perp had a knife, maybe the bullet came from someone else. Hmm.

Wait, in Testimony 2, Cosmos says the figure fired at them. But if the figure fired, then the bullet would be from the figure's gun. However, Evidence 10 mentions the bullet hole is from a .38-caliber, and Evidence 15 says Arme's bullet (which is .38) was found near the victim's oxygen tank. So there's a conflict here. Because if the figure in the lounge fired at Cosmos and Arme in the Control Room, then the bullet hole in the lounge (Evidence 10) would be from that shot. But the bullet found there is from a .38, which is Arme's. So perhaps the figure didn't fire, but Arme did. That contradicts the testimony where Cosmos says the figure fired. Alternatively, maybe the figure didn't have a gun but used a knife. Let me check the evidence again.

Evidence 3 is the Utility Knife, which was the murder weapon. Evidence 14 (Aura's Statement) says the perp had a knife in the right hand and a lighter in the left. So the perp used a knife, not a gun. But the bullet hole (Evidence 10) is a .38, which is Arme's. So maybe Arme fired the bullet, not the figure. Therefore, Testimony 2 is false because the figure didn't fire; it was Arme. That would mean Cosmos is lying or mistaken when he says the figure fired at them. So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 15 (Arme's bullet) and Evidence 10 (bullet hole from .38). Alternatively, Evidence 12 is a .10 caliber bullet found in the gutter. But that's different.

Wait, Testimony 2 says the figure fired at them while they were in the Control Room. But the Control Room's door is to the east (Evidence 11), and the bullet hole in the lounge (where the victim was) is .38. If the figure was in the lounge and fired towards the Control Room, but the Control Room is east, and the lounge is... looking at the Space Center Diagram (Evidence 2), but perhaps the layout is such that a shot from the lounge to the Control Room would require the bullet to go through certain areas. However, the bullet hole in the lounge (Evidence 10) is in the boarding lounge where the victim was found. So if the figure fired at Cosmos and Arme in the Control Room, the bullet would have gone from the lounge to the Control Room, leaving a hole in the lounge. But Evidence 10's bullet hole is in the lounge, made by a .38. Then the bullet that hit there would have been fired from the Control Room towards the lounge. Wait, that's confusing. Let me think.

Alternatively, maybe the bullet hole in the lounge is from when someone shot in the lounge. If the figure fired at Cosmos and Arme in the Control Room, then the bullet would have gone from the lounge (where the figure was) towards the Control Room (east). But the bullet hole is in the lounge, which would mean the shooter was in the Control Room firing into the lounge. But the testimony says the figure fired at them while they were in the Control Room, implying the figure was outside (in the lounge) firing into the Control Room. So the bullet hole would be in the Control Room, but Evidence 10 says it's in the lounge. That's a contradiction. Because if the figure fired from the lounge towards the Control Room, the bullet hole should be in the Control Room's direction, but the hole is in the lounge. Therefore, Testimony 2's statement that the figure fired at them in the Control Room is contradicted by the location of the bullet hole (lounge) and the fact that the bullet found there is from Arme's gun. Therefore, the bullet was fired by Arme, not the figure. Hence, Testimony 2 is contradicted by Evidence 15 (Arme's bullet) and Evidence 10. But how does this pair up? The testimony in question is Testimony 2, and the evidence is 15 or 10. Alternatively, maybe the evidence that the Control Room door can only be opened by the director (Evidence 11) conflicts with Testimony 0 where Arme and Cosmos rushed there together. But if the door is locked and only Cosmos can open it, then Testimony 0 is possible if Cosmos opened it for Arme. So that might not be the contradiction.

Another angle: Testimony 2 says they were in the Control Room when the figure fired. But according to Evidence 8 (Oxygen Tank Data), the victim's tank was struck by a bullet from a .38 (Evidence 15). If Arme fired the bullet that hit the victim's tank, then she must have been in the vicinity. But according to Testimony 0, they went to the Control Room. If they were in the Control Room, how could Arme's bullet hit the victim's tank in the lounge? Unless the Control Room is adjacent, but the bullet's path would need to be possible. However, if the Control Room is to the east (per Evidence 11), and the boarding lounge is on the third floor (Evidence 1), maybe the layout allows that. Alternatively, if the bullet hole in the lounge (Evidence 10) is from a .38, which matches Arme's gun (Evidence 15), then Arme fired that bullet. But according to Testimony 2, the figure fired at them while they were in the Control Room. So if Arme was in the Control Room and fired back, but the bullet hole is in the lounge, that would mean she shot towards the lounge. But Cosmos says the figure fired at them, implying the figure was the shooter. But the bullet evidence suggests Arme fired. Therefore, Testimony 2 is contradicted by Evidence 15, which shows that Arme's bullet was involved, not the figure. So the testimony says the figure fired, but the evidence shows Arme's bullet was there. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 15. But wait, Evidence 15 says the bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank was from Arme's .38. So if Arme fired that bullet, then she must have been present in the lounge, but according to Testimony 0, she was with Cosmos in the Control Room. Unless she left, but the testimonies don't mention that. Alternatively, maybe the figure didn't fire a gun at all, but Arme did. So the testimony that the figure fired is contradicted by the evidence that the bullet came from Arme's gun. Therefore, the contradiction is Testimony 2 (figure fired) vs Evidence 15 (Arme's bullet). So the correct pair is Evidence 15 and Testimony 2.

But let me check another possibility. Evidence 12 is a .10 caliber bullet found in the gutter. If the figure had a .10 gun, but Testimony 2 says they fired, which would be the .10, but Evidence 10's bullet hole is .38. So maybe there are two bullets: one from Arme's .38 (Evidence 15) and another .10 (Evidence 12). But Testimony 2 says the figure fired at them, which could be the .10, but that bullet is found in the gutter, not in the Control Room. So perhaps the figure fired a .10, but the testimony says they fired at Cosmos and Arme in the Control Room. If that's the case, the bullet should be in the Control Room area, but it's found in the gutter. Hmm, maybe that's another contradiction. However, the main contradiction seems to be Testimony 2 (figure fired) vs Evidence 15 (Arme's bullet found near the victim), implying Arme fired, not the figure. Therefore, the correct pair is Testimony 2 and Evidence 15. But Evidence 15 is the bullet from Arme's gun found near the victim's oxygen tank. So if the figure fired at them in the Control Room, but Arme's bullet is in the victim's area, that suggests Arme was there, which contradicts Testimony 0 where she was in the Control Room. Wait, Testimony 0 says they rushed to the Control Room together, Testimony 2 says they were in the Control Room when the figure fired. So if they were in the Control Room, how did Arme's bullet end up near the victim in the lounge? Unless Arme fired from the Control Room into the lounge. But the bullet hole in the lounge (Evidence 10) is a .38, which matches Arme's gun. So maybe Arme fired from the Control Room into the lounge, creating the bullet hole and hitting the oxygen tank. Then, the figure in the lounge (from Testimony 1) had a knife, not a gun. Therefore, Cosmos's Testimony 2 that the figure fired at them is false because the figure didn't have a gun. The actual shooter was Arme, which is supported by her bullet being found there. So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 (figure fired) and Evidence 14 (figure had a knife) or Evidence 15 (Arme's bullet). Evidence 14 says the perp had a knife and a lighter. So the figure couldn't have fired a gun. Therefore, Testimony 2's claim that the figure fired is contradicted by Evidence 14 and 15. The direct contradiction would be Testimony 2 and Evidence 14 (Aura's Statement). Because Aura's Statement says the perp had a knife, not a gun. If the figure in the lounge is the perp (with a knife), then they couldn't have fired a gun. Therefore, Testimony 2's claim that the figure fired at them is impossible, as the perp had a knife. Hence, the contradiction is between Testimony 2 and Evidence 14. Let's confirm: Testimony 2 says the figure fired at them, Evidence 14 says the perp had a knife in right hand and lighter in left. Therefore, the figure (perp) couldn't have fired a gun. Therefore, the testimony is contradicted by Evidence 14. So the pair is Evidence 14 and Testimony 2.
